title: Oil climbs more than $1/barrel as OPEC, allied producers agree record output cut
text: Oil prices jumped more than $1 a barrel on Monday after major producers finally agreed their biggest-ever output cut, but gains were capped amid concern that it won't be enough to head off oversupply with the coronavirus pandemic hammering demand.

title: The Fed’s Big Bazooka
text: Chairman Powell signaled that the Fed was prepared to expand their balance sheet indefinitely. The announcement alone had a huge impact on corporate bond prices.

title: Oil Price War Ends With OPEC+ Deal to Cut Output
text: The world’s top oil producers pulled off a historic deal to cut global petroleum output by nearly a 10th, putting an end to the devastating price war between Saudi Arabia and Russia.

title: Oil, equities slip as OPEC+ cut fails to lift confidence
text: Oil prices and U.S. stock futures dipped in early Monday trade as a landmark agreement by OPEC and its allies to slash output by a record amount failed to give investors any cause for lasting optimism about the economic outlook.

title: Another Record Year For Low-Cost U.S. Natural Gas - And Why That’s Good News

title: US stock futures down ahead of earnings week for big banks
text: US stock futures were down on Sunday evening, ahead of a week when many companies will begin reporting earnings for the three months ending in March, offering a look at how corporate America's finances have been hit by coronavirus.

title: Major oil-producing nations agree historic 10% cut in output
text: Saudi Arabia and Russia reach truce after collapse in demand caused by coronavirus

text: Oil futures Sunday evening bounced around, giving up a sharp gain in electronic trade, after Saudi Arabia, Russia and the U.S.

title: Iraqi oil minister says big oil cut deal will help to stabilize oil market
text: Iraq's oil minister said late on Sunday that the big oil cut deal reached at an OPEC+ meeting would help stabilize the market.

title: U.S. stock futures decline in choppy trade after oil producers reach pact to end price war
text: U.S. stock-index futures opened higher Sunday evening but soon gave up early gains, tracking choppy trade in oil futures after major oil producers reached an agreement on output cuts that ends a price war between Russia and Saudi Arabia.

title: Oil prices are flat after OPEC and allies agree to historic production cut
text: Oil prices were flat in overnight trading after OPEC and its allies agreed to a historic deal to cut production by a record 9.7 million barrels per day.

title: US stock futures are flat as investors weigh coronavirus and oil outlook
text: U.S. stock futures were flat on Sunday night after OPEC and other oil-producing countries reached a deal on a massive production cut.

title: OPEC+ deal could boost oil prices, but oversupply remains
text: An oil producer deal to make record output cuts will lend some support this week to oil prices that have lost half their value this year as the coronavirus hammers demand.

title: Canada welcomes oil cut deal, says it is committed to achieving price certainty
text: Canada on Sunday formally welcomed a deal by OPEC and allies to cut oil output by a record amount, saying Ottawa was committed to achieving price certainty and economic stability.

title: OPEC+ Agrees To Historic Deal To Cut Oil Prices
text: Following several days of meetings that began last Thursday, a historic oil deal has been reached.

title: Robert Shiller: Pandemic of fear could tip economy into a depression
text: Nobel-prize winning economist Robert Shiller warns a painful self-fulfilling prophecy may be unfolding in the market.

title: OPEC+ reaches deal to cut oil production by 9.7 million barrels per day
text: In an emergency virtual meeting Sunday, OPEC+ arrived at a deal to slash oil production by 9.7 million barrels a day starting May 1, a senior OPEC source told CNN. The cuts will remain in place through June, the source said.

title: Saudi energy minister says OPEC+ effective oil cuts are 12.5 million bpd
text: The Saudi energy minister said on Sunday that effective oil supply cuts by OPEC and its allies, a group known as OPEC+, will amount to 12.5 million barrels per day, because of higher output in April from Saudi Arabia, the United Arab Emirates and Kuwait.

title: Oil agreement could support stocks, providing a floor
text: An agreement by oil producing nations to cut output by a record amount may sustain a recent bounce in stocks, though stay-at-home restrictions and closures tied to the coronavirus pandemic continue to weigh on the global economy.

title: Trump says 'great' OPEC+ deal will save U.S. jobs
text: U.S. President Donald Trump on Sunday praised a deal among the world's top oil producers to cut global petroleum output, saying it would save jobs in the U.S. energy industry.

title: World’s Top Oil Producers Agree To Historic Deal To End Devastating Price War
text: The coronavirus outbreak has caused oil demand to plummet.

title: UAE committed to reducing oil production from its current 4.1 million bpd:  Energy minister
text: The United Arab Emirates is committed to reducing oil production from its current level of 4.1 million barrels per day (MBOPD), energy minister Suhail Al Mazrouei said in a tweet on Sunday.

title: Kremlin says leaders of Russia, U.S., Saudi Arabia support OPEC+ oil deal
text: Russian President Vladimir Putin, U.S. President Donald Trump and Saudi Arabia's King Salman all supported the OPEC+ deal to cut global crude output, the Kremlin said on Sunday.

title: Another Bullish Week
text: It was another big rally-week for stocks, with the S&P climbing 12%. However, while these gains are welcomed by investors, it turns out that slower, smaller moves are more indicative of a healthy bull market.

title: Mexico's energy minister says oil producers agreed to cut output by 9.7 mln bpd from May
text: Mexico's Energy Minister Rocio Nahle said on Sunday oil producers unanimously agreed to cut output by 9.7 million barrels per day from May at OPEC+ talks and thanked OPEC members for their support in reaching the deal.

title: OPEC and allies finalize record oil production cut after days of discussion
text: The 9.7 million barrels per day cut will begin on May 1, and will extend through the end of June.

title: OPEC+ agrees largest ever oil output cut of 9.7 million bpd: sources
text: OPEC, Russia and other oil producing nations agreed on Sunday to cut output by a record amount, representing around 10% of global supply, to support oil prices amid the coronavirus pandemic, sources said.

title: Volatile Start to 2020 – What’s Next?
text: Last year’s prognostications about the events and trends to monitor in 2020 have evaporated as COVID-19 has upended people’s lives and caused massive recalibrations in financial markets.

title: Fed's Neel Kashkari says coronavirus economic recovery 'could be a long, hard road'
text: Kashkari's comments came days after the Labor Department reported that another 6.6 million Americans filed first-time unemployment claims in the past week.

title: Russian, Saudi ministers to chair OPEC+ meeting on Sunday: Azerbaijan
text: Russian Energy Minister Alexander Novak and Saudi Energy Minister Prince Abdulaziz bin Salman will chair an OPEC and non-OPEC online meeting later on Sunday, the Azerbaijan energy ministry said.

title: OPEC and allies will hold an emergency virtual meeting Sunday night to finalize cut agreement

title: OPEC, allies to confer on Sunday to try to end standoff over cuts plan: sources
